docs.abstract: Never paired together at one of golf’s majors, the rivals Brooks Koepka and Bryson DeChambeau instead went head-to-head in a spectacle for charity off the Las Vegas Strip.
docs.snippet: Never paired together at one of golf’s majors, the rivals Brooks Koepka and Bryson DeChambeau instead went head-to-head in a spectacle for charity off the Las Vegas Strip.
docs.lead_paragraph: Black Friday, an unofficial American holiday dedicated to commercialism and being sold to, felt like an appropriate date for the fifth installment of “The Match.” This made-for-TV series of golf matches started three years ago behind the star power of Tiger Woods and Phil Mickelson and has since included superstars from football and basketball. This time it came calling for major championship winners with golf’s most out-in-the-open conflict, Brooks Koepka and Bryson DeChambeau.

headline.main: A Feud Fueled by Social Media Is Also Made for TV
headline.print_headline: No Blood Is Shed as Koepka Wins Grudge Match With DeChambeau

docs.abstract: In an interview on Sunday, the revered composer and lyricist, 91, contentedly discussed his shows running on Broadway and off, as well as a new movie about to be released.
docs.snippet: In an interview on Sunday, the revered composer and lyricist, 91, contentedly discussed his shows running on Broadway and off, as well as a new movie about to be released.
docs.lead_paragraph: ROXBURY, Conn. — Stephen Sondheim stood by the gleaming piano in his study, surrounded by posters of international productions of his many famous musicals, and smiled as he inquired whether a visitor might be interested in hearing songs from a show he had been working on for years, but hadn’t finished yet.

headline.main: Days Before Dying, Stephen Sondheim Reflects: ‘I’ve Been Lucky’
headline.print_headline: In His Final Days, Giving a Peek of a Last Show

docs.abstract: A tour of the flood-ravaged parts of the province finds communities supporting each other following disaster.
docs.snippet: A tour of the flood-ravaged parts of the province finds communities supporting each other following disaster.
docs.lead_paragraph: For much of this week, I’ve been traveling through some of the flood-ravaged areas of British Columbia and speaking with people whose lives have been upturned by the province’s second natural disaster in six months.

headline.main: In the Midst of the Mud and Destruction, British Columbians Come Together

docs.abstract: Scientists do not yet know how dangerous the new Omicron variant is, but its many mutations set off alarms, lowering hopes of putting the pandemic in the past.
docs.snippet: Scientists do not yet know how dangerous the new Omicron variant is, but its many mutations set off alarms, lowering hopes of putting the pandemic in the past.
docs.lead_paragraph: The world reacted with alarm on Friday to the highly mutated new coronavirus variant discovered in southern Africa, as the United States, the European Union and nations across the globe imposed new travel restrictions, financial markets swooned and visions of finally emerging from the pandemic started to dim.

headline.main: New ‘Variant of Concern’ Fuels Global Fear of Another Virus Surge
headline.print_headline: CHLT28B THRE LINE OF HED HERE IN TH  SPACE OVER THREIL

byline.original: By Richard Pérez-Peña and Jason Horowitz

docs.abstract: In a never before seen interview, Stephen Sondheim sat down with The New York Times in June 2008 to talk about his life, career and accomplishments.
docs.snippet: In a never before seen interview, Stephen Sondheim sat down with The New York Times in June 2008 to talk about his life, career and accomplishments.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a never before seen interview, Stephen Sondheim sat down with The New York Times in June 2008 to talk about his life, career and accomplishments.

byline.original: By Matthew Orr, Mervyn Rothstein and Robin Stein

docs.abstract: Former President Donald J. Trump’s son-in-law is trying to raise capital for his investment firm and is turning to a region that he dealt with extensively while in the White House.
docs.snippet: Former President Donald J. Trump’s son-in-law is trying to raise capital for his investment firm and is turning to a region that he dealt with extensively while in the White House.
docs.lead_paragraph: As a White House adviser in the Trump administration, Jared Kushner took a special interest in the petroleum-rich monarchies of the Persian Gulf.

headline.main: Seeking Backers for New Fund, Jared Kushner Turns to Middle East

byline.original: By Kate Kelly, David D. Kirkpatrick and Alan Rappeport

docs.abstract: The Omicron variant carries worrisome mutations that may let it evade antibodies, scientists said. But it will take more research to know how it fares against vaccinated people.
docs.snippet: The Omicron variant carries worrisome mutations that may let it evade antibodies, scientists said. But it will take more research to know how it fares against vaccinated people.
docs.lead_paragraph: Scientific experts at the World Health Organization warned on Friday that a new coronavirus variant discovered in southern Africa was a “variant of concern,” the most serious category the agency uses for such tracking.

headline.main: New Virus Variant Stokes Concern but Vaccines Still Likely to Work
headline.print_headline: Omicron Variant Labeled Dangerous, But More Study Needed, Experts Say

docs.lead_paragraph: A new variant of the coronavirus was reported in South Africa, sending stocks around the world tumbling and prompting the U.S. and other countries to reinstate travel restrictions. The W.H.O. said the new variant was “of concern” and gave it the name Omicron.

docs.abstract: Hours after South African scientists announced the existence of a troublesome new variant, Britain banned travelers from southern Africa. The United States and other nations quickly followed suit.
docs.snippet: Hours after South African scientists announced the existence of a troublesome new variant, Britain banned travelers from southern Africa. The United States and other nations quickly followed suit.
docs.lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG — As the United States and European countries close their borders over fears over the recently detected coronavirus variant, many South Africans say they feel as if they are being “punished” for alerting global health authorities.

headline.main: After detecting the Omicron variant, South Africa feels ‘punished’ by global travel bans.

docs.abstract: At least 46 miners were killed in an explosion at a Siberian mine. The director of the mine has been taken into police custody, along with five other administrators.
docs.snippet: At least 46 miners were killed in an explosion at a Siberian mine. The director of the mine has been taken into police custody, along with five other administrators.
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — In the days before his death in a mine explosion in Russia’s coal-rich Kuzbass region, Boris Piyalkin lamented that the safety standards in his workplace were inadequate.

headline.main: A Mine Disaster in Russia Highlights Safety Shortfalls in Rush to Dig Coal
headline.print_headline: Mine Disaster in Russia Highlights Safety Defects
